availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thompson Steele Parks (Nicholas County, Kentucky, farmer. )

body.p: Nicholas County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth Ingram Dorsey Parks in Nicholas County, Kentucky, on January 11, 1838. Father of Mary Parks and Nancy Parks. Farmer in Nicholas County, Kentucky, in 1850. Employed William Wall as a laborer in Nicholas County in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons in Nicholas County in 1850. Member of the Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Nicholas and Fleming counties from 1851-1853. Farmer in Nicholas County in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Nicholas County in 1860.

"Kentucky Legislature," Louisville Journal (Louisville, KY), September 6, 1851, p. 4.
